audioText: Il perdrait sûrement ce procès à cause de la double accusation portée par le juge.
question: What does the speaker say about why he would surely lose this trial?
options: Because of the double accusation brought by the judge
Because his lawyer lacks sufficient legal experience
Because the evidence against him is overwhelming
Because the jury is biased against his case
explanation: The text states 'Il perdrait sûrement ce procès à cause de la double accusation portée par le juge' - He would surely lose this trial because of the double accusation brought by the judge. 'Perdrait' is the third-person singular conditional of 'perdre' (to lose), and 'double' means 'double'. The distractors test misinterpretation of the reason (lawyer lacks experience, evidence overwhelming, jury biased).
